dialogues.text: This is her equally on-the-rag boy- friend, Nick Leavitt--
--they're from UMass, doing some kind of fucking term paper--
We're not making Blair Witch II here.
We're all going to be if you don't hit the brakes.
You drive, I'll handle the video, okay?
Right. And the check's in the mail.
Was it <u>every</u> day or just semi- weekly you got your ass kicked as a kid?
<u>Now</u> you can bring the vehicle to a stop: there on the left.
Either way, maybe there's a book in it, and they both make a ton of money.
No problem, just give us 'til dawn and we're gone.
Look, guys, we're cold, we're tired we're <u>shook</u>--we just want to get out of here as soon as there's light. We saw something up at Coffin Rock today--
Due for a re-load and battery check. I'll get on it.
--and none of 'em were mine! I-am-so-fucked, I-am-so-fucked-- where the hell was everybody???
Cotter, I think she's right. Why would those guys go to all the trouble of stealing the camera and all this other stuff and leave the tapes?
They were making a movie--if they were going to steal anything it'd be <u>just</u> the tapes, to see if we had anything they didn't.
I dunno it's safe to even get out of the car.
First enormous brick warehouse on your right.
Just one lock in this neighbor- hood?
There's four other angles, man, we haven't even--
--great: we can watch Domini sleep for hours--or, shit, maybe if we stay at it for a couple of days, maybe a deer'll dash by!
--still go see the OB in the morning--
You wanna keep it down, she's trying to sleep.
Sorry, I didn't think we were making that much noise.
It's not a real "funny" time for us, okay?
Well, she's got to be <u>somewhere</u> here.
No one's been in or out since you left. Would've heard the dogs.
How much of that stuff you guys been smoking?
Enough to make shapes and shadows in the dark into something else.
I think it's time to get out of here.

It's Domini, it's not Domini, I don't care--all I know is <u>I'm</u> not dealing with something--<u>anything</u>-- snuffing me in my sleep. I want to do what we did in the woods-- surveillance of this whole place 24/7, with somebody monitoring those cameras every second. There's something, somebody here, I want to see 'em coming.
I thought all your equipment got stolen.
All the shit that was worth anything, yes. You'd be amazed, though, what you can get free on the 'net.
Just let it go, I've got you!
Maybe whatever they are, they just haven't appeared yet on her?
Why don't you just cut it down and count the goddamn rings--who <u>cares</u>?
Because it means the tree is older than the house.
'Give you a hand. I think my sleep for the night just ended.
I need you to talk to me, talk to me about the dreams--about James, the other boys.
I don't...I don't understand them myself.
--bad boys, mean boys, <u>cowardly</u> boys--just like Domini.
A coward too. That's why she had to go.
What happened to her, where did she go?
Don't know--just that she was afraid--
My eye, is there something in my eye?
Closer. Lift the lid and look-- it hurts.
You killed Domini, didn't you, witch??
I'm not a witch, you're all crazy!
Please! Please...? I haven't done anything.
--she wasn't a witch--we embrace nature, not evil--
The good old days: toasting marsh- mallows over a burning witch.
They never burned witches in this country, they hanged them.
Whatever--all I know is the persecution's going to start all over again, they keep pumping out inflammatory bullshit like this fucking movie--
Finally got her back to sleep.
Nick, what you should do is get her back up and get her to a goddamn <u>doctor</u>.
Jesus, you don't think I know that? You don't think I've tried? She won't fucking <u>go</u>-- she won't leave this place.
Yeah, I know. It's...alright. We're all a little--
You think....there could've been something up in those woods that Anna--

--it's not a could've--there <u>was</u>, Nick. And it fucked up Anna, and did something to Domini, and it caused my father to die, and it's here <u>with</u> us in this place <u>now</u>. And I don't have one single idea in hell what's going to happen next, just that it's going to happen to one of us. And then the other. And then the other. It's going to get into our <u>brains</u>.
There's explanations. Rational explanations for everything that's happened. We'll drive ourselves crazy if we keep obsessing on supernatural what-ifs.
That feels good. Lower--down into my neck.
I dunno it's anything. It's a name Anna's mentioned--from her dreams.
Hey, chemicals, fear, sleep- deprivation--and a round-the-clock obsession with the occult--hell've a recipe for a mind-fuck.
We are being fucked with here, someone or something.
--why in the world would she just fly the coop in the first place?
We're not dealing with fucking logic here!
Don't! You're making me lose my grip.
Or a blood blister--or a bruise.
Put 'em together that's a "k." James Kurth--
--or Lyme Disease or poison sumac, or God knows what-else we could have picked up in the woods.
You <u>know</u> what we picked up in the woods--
I thought all witches were benign and good.
What the fuck's going on here?
Does she have marks, Nick--like the ones we have, that Domini had?
Not that I've seen--but that has no meaning--that means nothing.
--the marks appear, then you disappear. Like the little Kurth boy, like Domini, as soon as they come to full bloom--and mine <u>are</u>!
There are <u>other</u> explanations! She is not the goddamn witch, that's insane!
Then just give me one of your explanations that all three of us'll buy.
It's like traveling back in time.
She <u>is</u>--she's helped solve a bunch of murders: Arizona, New Mexico--
No, the kids were actors, the townspeople were real. Her, the Sheriff, the Convenience Store guy--
--doesn't just pop out of thin air. It spins off of real events. At some point there <u>was</u> a Blair Witch--
--or one huge attack of group hysteria.
--chalked just hours ago by ancient adolescents. It's called vandalism.
That's a sapling--<u>this</u> mother's got to be three hundred years old, minimum.
It's a <u>sketch</u>, Anna--it's not to- scale cartography; the tree was not the kids' focus--
Okay, fine, whatever, yes--it's an <u>old</u> tree.
--brother of Rustin Parr's maternal grandfather, somewhere after 1858--
--<u>whoever</u>--they built an entire house <u>around</u> a <u>tree</u>. Sticking up right through the living room. Somebody like to explain that to me?
The rest of the family was crazy as Rusty Parr.
Oh, <u>c'mon</u>--even you have to admit this is weird.
Your parents didn't have a <u>bigger</u> one?
It was <u>free</u>--I recall that was the chief selling point for you.
You know, Nick, you've been something of a total asshole the past few days.
Pardon me, I've had a few things on my mind--like putting this safari together.
Like how weirded-out you are with this pregnancy thing.
Let's just leave it at: it was one hell of a surprise.
Could we take this up later--like indoors, without half the world listening?
You feel no need to get married or anything.
You want me to scooch over next to you?
--scared the living shit out of us.
This is a goddamn disaster. Let's just pack it up and go.
I want to see the tapes.
And what do you possibly think you're going to fucking see there?
No idea. But if that's all we've got left--
I think we get the gist.
We've looked at half of one tape.
For once could you just sit down, shut up, and give something a <u>chance</u>?
We're leaving--case dismissed for lack of evidence. Maybe on the ride home we can figure how the fuck we're going to graduate with no thesis.
We'll stay overnight, get a hotel--
Just...try and go back to sleep.
I get dreams. I don't like 'em.
Little boys. Looking up my skirt as I danced. Giggling.

I don't know what it is, but there is something <u>happening</u> here, and it's starting to scare the living shit out me, and look, I'm just <u>not</u> going to argue the point anymore--you want to stay here, stay, but I've got to get the fuck out of here, and I'm begging you to come <u>with</u> me.
--no, you're not. You love me too much. You don't want to see them kill me.
The clothes--take 'em off-- I want to see every square inch--
I see for proof positive you're the goddamn witch--
--what're you saying?? I didn't have anything to do with--
--fuck your bullshit pieties! You were the next to die, asshole!
Shit? This is from "Josh's Blair Witch Mix," man!
Down or off--you're giving me a migraine.
Just trying to set the mood for the mission--get the "feeling."
Only thing I'm feeling is homicidal.
The bitched-out babe in back here is one Anna Tassio--we met one dark and stormy night in a Blair Witch chat room, we all did--
--but she was nicer then--sweeter-- she hadn't vomited twice already like today--
--a six week bun in the oven--
Guess they thought it was safe to put some up again.
She e-mailed me yesterday this is where we should meet her.
No idea, just talked to her on the 'Net--she's very good.
I dunno, probably right up there, based on her resume.
Where they found the backpacks and all the film a year later.
Buried deep under 200 years worth of soil, ash, and compost layers.
No. What's it doing here in the middle of the foundation?
This is funny?? This is tens of thousands of fucking dollars!  You pricks! I'll see you in fucking court!!
Not the only things missing, Nick.
You can be goddamn sure, though, I'm going to be looking at every second of 'em when I get back to Baltimore--I get proof who stole my shit and I call the cops!
We're ticketed to fly back from Baltimore, anyway.
That's its name. A pastoral glade gamboling with crackheads and homeless and averaging at least one homicide a week.
There's some stuff that's hard to part with. Editing's stuff's up there--
Hang you like the witch you are, unless--
--thank you, Heather Arendt--and arend't we glad you're here--a real witch--
And let it be known--before we even get to Burkittsville--it's gonna be an eighteen thousand times better movie--for half the cost--
--and unlike the first one, every second of it's gonna be true! "Blair Witch: The Real Story!"
You're a complete fucking idiot, aren't you?
Hey, Mr. Graduate Fucking Thesis here was s'posed to be driving!
Oh, for chrissake, she was an actor.
I take it back--she <u>wasn't</u> an actor. She's a nutjob.
That's what Josh and Mike said.
You're not only an idiot, you're a goddamn <u>child</u>.
Why does everyone here but me have have a gigantic stick up their ass?
Hadn't even opened the thing since Cub scouts.
So where the hell am I going to sleep?
If you're looking at me, look elsewhere.
I've got the Panasonic Portable DVD player.
Ask me what I don't have.
What I never could figure about the movie?
Three people: two guys, a girl-- sleeping in the same motel room, the same tent night after night.
Made no sense. Scared out of their minds, and the greatest stress reliever in creation right at their fingertips. Nada.
No sense at all.  I'm a little stressed.
What're you doing with all this shit?
Hey, I got a whole editing suite in my loft--more the fucking merrier.
Not a great idea. Especially 'cross the street.
Used to be a meat-packing plant. Slaughter on the ground floor-- carcasses schlepped up on this thing for dissection and grinding and--
Hey, hon'--this is what pays the rent and tuition.
I spend a lot of time on e-Bay. Buying, selling--sometimes buying then re-selling at substantial mark-up, sometimes just selling crap I find in the street.
I got the tape enhanced--and I managed to sleaze a photo blow-up. Jesus, he's gonna kill me when he finds out about the camera.
My room, asleep, last I checked.
She would've had to have a key, anyway, to lock the deadbolt behind her.
Well, she got out of here <u>some</u>- how because she's not here!!
Same trees. They took Elly Kedward out to the same kind of trees.
--I look and look in the tree, all I ever see, he's always there watching, that stupid owl, over and over--
--anywhere, anywhere, all up and live, all the time--fucking owl--
You think it's possible the tree in the Parr foundation is the same one they tied Elly Kedward to?
Heather, does that look like Domini there?
Not the place you want to announce your arrival.
How's she going to know where to--
--things got a way of finding <u>you</u> here.
Next time try putting on shoes--
The moon trying to shoot down through all these trees--can make things funky--
The cart they brought Elly Kedward into the woods with--
--into the <u>Black</u> <u>Hills</u> with--200- something miles from here--
I'd strongly advise you to join us--
--hell, I don't think I'm ever leaving this place again--

--one of us, all of us--I have no idea--brought whatever this thing is back here. We're not going to go out there and spread it around like Typhoid Mary. We're gonna figure it out, we're gonna bring a goddamn <u>end</u> to it.
Goes right along with these two.
--f'chrissake, Heather, it's not like the two of us are gonna doze off he leaves for two seconds--
--I don't trust anybody, not even me, anymore--
--it's the "Blair Witch Cult"--a copy-- some pages from--one of them on the site must've gotten my message--
Remember....what Mary Brown said-- she could see the witch's hands on my face, her mouth sucking on mine.
